Our “reconnaissance” of Al Zahbi is but a ruse.
No, my true mission is far greater--to bring General Gadalar to fight along my side!${prompt}
……どうやら来たようだな。
お前の相手はここで終わりだ。${prompt}

It was you, Shayeeha.${prompt}

Bwahahaha!${prompt}
無事なら良い。
かつての同僚の生死を確認しただけだ。
もう戻る。${prompt}

Just ask that mercenary over there.${prompt}

Commander Gadalar, listen to me!${prompt}

Commander Gadalar, how can you stomach this!?

...${prompt}
Our warlord knows firsthand of your prowess.

Come with me!${prompt}

The Voidwatch is a fellowship of men and women come together to defend the world from extradimensional invaders called “Voidwalkers.” Driven only by an insatiable appetite for destruction, these fell horrors roam the space between dimensions, ever seeking to enter and plunge Vana'diel into chaos.${prompt}
Faced with the risk of mass invasion, Voidwatch leaders devised a strategy wherein potential threats are preemptively neutralized.
This act was made possible through the discovery of voidstones, magicked objects capable of rendering Voidwalkers visible to be summarily dispatched.${prompt}
Such efforts to stem the rise of Voidwalkers, collectively dubbed “Voidwatch Operations,” or “Ops” for short, take place in the vicinity of planar rifts--weak points in the fabric of space.${prompt}

A single person may initiate a Voidwatch operation, at which time “Voidwatcher” status will be bestowed upon all qualifying party and alliance members, allowing them to commence battle with the target Voidwalker.${prompt}

Voidwatch Ops are subject to a time limit. Exceed this limit and Voidwatcher status will be revoked for all involved, bringing the confrontation to an end. Individuals straying too far from the site of battle, too, will find themselves relieved of the status.${prompt}
Know also that those who take on the burden of the Voidwatcher become temporarily isolated and unable to receive aid from the outside world.
Such is the arduous nature of transdimensional encounters.${prompt}
Initiating a Voidwatch operation requires a voidstone, as well as a stratum abyssite attuned to a particular planar rift.${prompt}
Only one person needs to be in possession of these objects for all party and alliance members to participate.${prompt}
However, there exists a number of participation conditions that must be observed.${prompt}
When an operation commences, a single voidstone will be expended for all who possess it.
These combatants will have the opportunity to improve their spoils by manipulating spectral alignment values during battle.${prompt}
Conversely, those not possessing their own voidstone will be limited in the spoils they can obtain.${prompt}
The “voidstone” is a magicked object which, when coupled with stratum abyssite, is capable of rendering Voidwalkers visible.${prompt}
Only a single combatant need possess a voidstone to allow all party and alliance members to participate in a Voidwatch operation.
Those without one, however, will find their spoils limited in both quantity and quality.${prompt}
As a single voidstone is automatically expended when the battle commences, it is recommended that you keep stock of your inventory.${prompt}
Those wishing to obtain the stones should speak to a Voidwatch officer, who is charged with issuing a set quantity at fixed intervals.${prompt}
Stratum abyssite are dynamic stones capable of evolution. By absorbing the energies emitted by felled Voidwalkers, they become attuned with other planar rifts.${prompt}
After defeating your quarry, present your stone to an atmacite refiner--specialists in the study of otherworld geology--to have its properties determined.${prompt}
Stratum abyssite growth occurs independently of voidstones, and the latter is not required to trigger development.${prompt}

Each dimension is composed of its own existential spectrum to which objects of that world are aligned. The act of rendering a Voidwalker visible is essentially an act of aligning oneself to its existential spectrum.${prompt}

While Voidwatchers are able to, for all practical purposes, interact with such creatures, they in fact fall short of full alignment. Symptoms of this imperfect state can be observed in the limited quantity and quality of spoils normally yielded by Voidwalkers.${prompt}

Compensating measures, however, exist which allow combatants to more closely attune themselves with their extradimensional foe. One such method involves the use of alignment-enhancing artifacts known as “ascent items.”${prompt}
Alignment values raised through ascent items will remain in place until such time as a riftworn pyxis is opened at the end of a successful operation.${prompt}
Those participating in Voidwatch Ops are recommended to plan ahead in order to make effective use of ascent items.${prompt}
Alignment values can also be raised in the midst of battle by striking at enemy weaknesses, causing their existential attunement to shift to your advantage.${prompt}

Blows can be dealt with abilities such as weapon skills and magic spells, and your choice of weakness and the manner in which you strike it will determine which hue of the alignment spectrum is affected.${prompt}
The existential spectrum is comprised of five lights (blue, red, yellow, green, and white), each of which influences reward yield.${prompt}
The precise workings of each light can be reviewed when examining your current alignment values.${prompt}
Upon the successful conclusion of battle, the alignment bonus as granted by ascent items and the exploitation of enemy weaknesses are combined to determine the spoils.${prompt}

Be forewarned: Voidwalkers are highly guileful beings and will not suffer the same weakness being struck twice. Combatants must be on constant watch for any changes that may occur during the course of battle.${prompt}
Atmacite is the physical agglomeration of a monster's soul, and a vessel for its feral instincts.
By infusing atmacite to one's body using ${keyitem-article: 0[2]}, it is possible to enhance one's battle prowess.${prompt}
Be aware, however, that powers granted by atmacite can be tapped only when engaged in a Voidwatch operation.${prompt}
Atmacite is resilient and will not be expended in the infusion process.${prompt}
Furthermore, infused atmacite will remain in place until voluntarily purged.${prompt}
As the configuration of atmacite is not possible during an operation, be sure to see to your battle preparations ahead of time.${prompt}
Cruor can be used to enrich atmacite, enhancing its potency. The amount of cruor required for enrichment and the resultant properties vary with atmacite.${prompt}
Atmacite can be enriched in stages to a maximum of level ${number: 0}.${prompt}
All Voidwatchers are urged to make atmacite enrichment a priority, for they might just mean the difference between life and death.${prompt}
Periapt are lucky charms that grant myriad beneficial effects ranging from improved vitality to general upturns in fortune.${prompt}
Especially sought after are those bestowing temporary items at the commencement of an operation, granting combatants a distinct advantage against the enemy.${prompt}
Although their acquisition can only be described as arduous, the benefits make them well worth the effort.${prompt}

What do you want?${prompt}
I'll ask you again... What do you want with Megomak?${prompt}
Oh, you know about Falak?
From what I hear, that's all anybody's talking about right now.${prompt}
Well, you did come bearing gifts, and I suppose I can give you the short version, but you're looking for details, right?${prompt}
In that case, there just so happens to be someone who knows much more about the subject than good old Megomak does.
Maybe you should pay 'em a visit?${prompt}
My friend was born to a brave and heroic family, but found it tough always being the youngest.
Really hasn't had much luck in life, that's for sure.${prompt}
Hm? You want to meet my friend who knows about Falak?${prompt}
Sorry, I sent 'em on important business at the Hazhalm Testing Grounds that needed taking care of.${prompt}
Actually, do you know the cave just beyond the Caedarva Mire?
There's a secret Aht Urhgan facility deep inside it!${prompt}
There, they used forbidden alchemy techniques to fuse different species of creatures into strange new monstrosities.${prompt}
Their artificial creations are known as chimeras.${prompt}
Lamia, puk, mandragora...
That facility has given life to countless creatures.${prompt}
It was a grand sanctuary of learning that attempted to approach the greatness of the gods themselves...${prompt}
I'm actually something of an alchemist myself, you know.${prompt}
I once used a stolen egg to create a chimera known as Khimaira 13, but it didn't turn out so well...${prompt}
I spent many agonizing days burned and tattered, but it did help me regain my sense of motivation.${prompt}
According to my friend, my beloved chimeras are needed for the dreaded battle yet to come.${prompt}
Hm? You want to know who this friend of Megomak's is?${prompt}
I already told you--on an errand for me at the Hazhalm Testing Grounds.
That's definitely who you should talk to about Falak.${prompt}
Actually, my friend's been gone for a while now...${prompt}
I was hoping to steal another egg...${prompt}
Maybe the Empire discovered my little plan!
I shudder to think what they might do to my friend!${prompt}
Hey, I need you to go check out the entrance to the Hazhalm Testing Grounds and see what's going on.
I'm counting on you.${prompt}
Megomak wants you to investigate the entrance to the Hazhalm Testing Grounds.${prompt}
Ah, you're back. Did you investigate the Hazhalm Testing Grounds like I asked?${prompt}
What's this? This is the ${keyitem-singular: 1[2]} I asked for!${prompt}
I'm not sure I understand the details, but it's good that I didn't go personally.${prompt}
I don't think Megomak could handle being chased around by some haughty automaton.${prompt}
At any rate, where are the Destiny Destroyers now?${prompt}
I told them how to reach the elder, so perhaps they went straight there.${prompt}
Ah, and here I was ready to treat them to ${article} ${item-article: 0[2]} and ${article} ${item-article: 1[2]} too...${prompt}
Hm? What are you still doing here?${prompt}
Oh, that's right! You wanted to learn more about Falak!${prompt}
You see, it all began several thousand years ago.${prompt}
Falak attempted to lay waste to Aht Urhgan, but was eventually stopped and separated into nine pieces.${prompt}
However, what you refer to as the Olduum civilization gave rise to some ingenious alchemists who knew nothing of fear.${prompt}
They lifted the seal on the “Urn of Sealing” and took those nine pieces and used them to create entirely new beings, consisting of three pieces each.${prompt}
That is how the three chimeras known as Tinnin, Sarameya, and Tyger were created, and research into chimeras began.${prompt}
You people don't get it...${prompt}
If Tinnin, Sarameya, and Tyger are combined, it'll lead to Falak's resurrection!${prompt}
Ah, there you are! I received the ${keyitem-singular: 1[2]} from this person here!${prompt}
You... Have we met before?${prompt}
How will you respond?
${selection-lines}
Yes, we have.
I don't think so.${prompt}
Bah, who cares? Hurry up and finish the story, will you?
In a way, it's about you, right?${prompt}
Fine. The hero of this story happens to be one of my ancestors.${prompt}
My ancestor was a renowned hero who came across a human who he could communicate with, a man named Ramuul.
Even though he was human, he knew the danger posed by Falak.
With the stone tablets, he sealed it away through three “islands”!${prompt}
To do so, he used a powerful relic known as the Olduum staff.
Only it is capable of breaking the rock!${prompt}
The tablet has become quite the hot spot. The place is crawling with the undead.${prompt}
Hey, Megomak. Do you think this crew is up to the task of protecting the staff?${prompt}
I've been assured as much. You needn't worry.${prompt}
Hey! Guard that thing like your life depends on it, because it does!
You can't let it fall into the hands of the undead!${prompt}
You're on your way to visit the elder, right?
You can find out more there.${prompt}
Okay! Let's get going!
Thanks for the help!${prompt}
Take care!
Well, did you get all that?
Basically, Falak is dangerous, and if the Immortals get their clammy hands on the Olduum staff, that monster will be brought back to life.${prompt}
Although, now that you know, I don't expect it to change anything for the better.
Just stay out of our way, okay?${prompt}
See you around. I've got experiments to perform on behalf of my beloved chimeras.${prompt}
Return to Ghatsad and report what you have learned from Megomak and the others.${prompt}
